questions.question: Calculate the values of X and Y in the following nuclear equation. 239U_> X Th+2 oc+2/3 92 Y

The empirical formula of lead(II) oxide was determined by passing excess dry hydrogen gas over 6.69g of heated lead(II) oxide. (a) What was the purpose of using excess dry hydrogen gas? (b) The mass of lead was found to he 6.21g.Determine the empirical formula of the oxide. (Pb = 207.0 0 = 16.0)

options.a: (a) To reduce the oxide to the metal (b) PbO
options.b: (a) To reduce the oxide to the metal (b) Pb2O
options.c: (a) To reduce the oxide to the metal (b) PbO2
options.d: (a) To reduce the oxide to the metal (b) Pb2O3

questions.answer: (a) To reduce the oxide to the metal (b) PbO

questions.question: The following data was obtained when a student carried out an experiment to determine the enthalpy change for the reaction between zinc and dilute hydrochloric acid. (a) Write the equation for the reaction. (b) Calculate the enthalpy change for the reaction. (Zn = 65.4, H = 1.0, Cl = 35.5)
What is the chemical formalae for rust?
A sample of water is suspected to contain sulphate ions. Describe an experiment that can be carried out to determine the presence of sulphate ions.

options.a: Add dilute hydrochloric acid and barium chloride solution to the sample
options.b: Add dilute hydrochloric acid and barium nitrate solution to the sample
options.c: Add dilute sulphuric acid and barium chloride solution to the sample
options.d: Add dilute sulphuric acid and barium nitrate solution to the sample

questions.answer: Add dilute hydrochloric acid and barium chloride solution to the sample

questions.question: Copper(II) ions react with excess aqueous ammonia to form a complex ion. (a) (i) Write an equation for the reaction that forms the complex ion. (ii) Name the complex ion. (b) Explain why CH4 is not acidic while HCl is acidic yet both compounds contain hydrogen.

options.a: (a) (i) Cu2+(aq) + 4NH3(aq) -> [Cu(NH3)4]2+(aq) (ii) Tetraamminecopper(II) ion (b) CH4 is not acidic because it does not contain hydrogen
options.b: (a) (i) Cu2+(aq) + 4NH3(aq) -> [Cu(NH3)4]2+(aq) (ii) Tetraamminecopper(II) ion (b) CH4 is not acidic because it does not contain hydrogen
options.c: (a) (i) Cu2+(aq) + 4NH3(aq) -> [Cu(NH3)4]2+(aq) (ii) Tetraamminecopper(II) ion (b) CH4 is not acidic because it does not contain hydrogen
options.d: (a) (i) Cu2+(aq) + 4NH3(aq) -> [Cu(NH3)4]2+(aq) (ii) Tetraamminecopper(II) ion (b) CH4 is not acidic because it does not contain hydrogen

questions.answer: (a) (i) Cu2+(aq) + 4NH3(aq) -> [Cu(NH3)4]2+(aq) (ii) Tetraamminecopper(II) ion (b) CH4 is not acidic because it does not contain hydrogen

questions.question: 20 cm3 of ethanoic acid was diluted to 400 cm3 of solution. Calculate the concentration of the solution in moles per litre. (C = 12.0 ; H = 1.0 ; 0 =16.0) (Density of ethanoic acid = 1.05 g/cm3)
Explain the observation made when chlorine gas is passed through a solution of potassium iodide.
In an experiment, concentrated nitric(V) acid was reacted with iron(II) sulphate. State and explain the observations made.
Explain how a student can establish whether a liquid sample extracted from a plant is pure. Anode Cathode

options.a: By measuring the boiling point of the liquid
options.b: By measuring the melting point of the liquid
options.c: By measuring the freezing point of the liquid
options.d: By measuring the density of the liquid

questions.answer: By measuring the boiling point of the liquid
